main event: On October 2, 1956, a civilian reported observing silver objects resembling discs and globes in New York, New York. The objects were seen to turn and climb slowly out of sight over a duration of 12 to 15 minutes. The investigation suggests the possibility that the objects were caused by an aircraft.
interesting points: The objects were described as silver discs and globes with the apparent size of 10-15 feet in diameter and moving erratically at an estimated speed of 100-200 mph.
The observation was made through field glasses at night under clear weather conditions with a full moon.
The witness positively identified the object as unidentified, and the investigation was closed with the conclusion that the object was of a meteorological nature.
The report also mentions three photographic pages and a drawing of the sighting.
Despite the conclusion of a meteorological nature, the report was classified as 'Secret' and declassified after 12 years.
sighted object: silver objects resembling discs and globes
